cat.gencat.ctti.canigo.arch.core.i18n

Class CustomResourceBundleMessageSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.context.support.MessageSourceSupport
      • org.springframework.context.support.AbstractMessageSource
        • org.springframework.context.support.AbstractResourceBasedMessageSource
          • org.springframework.context.support.ResourceBundleMessageSource
            • cat.gencat.ctti.canigo.arch.core.i18n.CustomResourceBundleMessageSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    I18nResourceBundleMessageSource, org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanClassLoaderAware, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.springframework.context.HierarchicalMessageSource, org.springframework.context.MessageSource

    public class CustomResourceBundleMessageSource
extends org.springframework.context.support.ResourceBundleMessageSource
implements org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, I18nResourceBundleMessageSource
    Implementation that provides access to resource bundles without need to specify the current locale
    Author:
    cscanigo

      • getResourceBundle

        public ResourceBundle getResourceBundle(String basename)
        Description copied from interface: I18nResourceBundleMessageSource
        Return a ResourceBundle for the given basename and code, fetching already generated MessageFormats from the cache.
        Specified by:
        getResourceBundle in interface I18nResourceBundleMessageSource
        Parameters:
        basename - the basename of the ResourceBundle
        Returns:
        the resulting ResourceBundle, or null if none found for the given basename

      • setBasenames

        public void setBasenames(String[] basenames)
        Set an array of basenames, each following ResourceBundle conventions: essentially, a fully-qualified classpath location. If it doesn't contain a package qualifier (such as org.mypackage), it will be resolved from the classpath root. Override parent behavior to allow folders
        Overrides:
        setBasenames in class org.springframework.context.support.AbstractResourceBasedMessageSource
        See Also:
        AbstractResourceBasedMessageSource.setBasename(java.lang.String), ResourceBundle.getBundle(String)
